org.apparatus_templi

Class UsbSerialConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apparatus_templi.SerialConnection
      • org.apparatus_templi.UsbSerialConnection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    gnu.io.SerialPortEventListener, EventListener

    public final class UsbSerialConnection
extends SerialConnection
    A serial connection to manage connection and data transfer to and from controller Arduino through a USB connection. Uses the RXTX library to provide hardware abstraction on various host operating systems.
    Author:
    Jonathan Nelson

      • serialPort

        gnu.io.SerialPort serialPort

    • Constructor Detail

      • UsbSerialConnection

        public UsbSerialConnection()
        Initialize the serial connection by attempting to automatically find a valid port.

      • UsbSerialConnection

        public UsbSerialConnection(String serialPortName)
        Initialize the serial connection with the specified port. If the port name give is null then will attempt to find a valid port from an internal list. If the given port name is not null then will only attempt to bind to the named serial port.
        Parameters:
        serialPortName - the name of the serial port or null to auto-detect.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        protected void initialize(String serialPortName)
        Initializes the serial connection to the given serial port. If a connection could not be established then will shutdown the system with a terminal failure. If a connection can be established then adds event listener for serialEvent(SerialPortEvent).
        Specified by:
        initialize in class SerialConnection

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Description copied from class: SerialConnection
        Returns the current state of the connection.
        Specified by:
        isConnected in class SerialConnection

      • close

        public void close()
        Description copied from class: SerialConnection
        Shutdown the connection.
        Specified by:
        close in class SerialConnection

      • serialEvent

        public void serialEvent(gnu.io.SerialPortEvent oEvent)
        Reads a single byte of data from the serial connection. If the byte read was valid (not -1) then the byte is sent to the MessageCenter for processing.

      • isDataAvailable

        boolean isDataAvailable()
        Description copied from class: SerialConnection
        Returns true if any data is available for reading, false otherwise.
        Specified by:
        isDataAvailable in class SerialConnection

      • readInputByte

        int readInputByte()
            throws IOException
        Description copied from class: SerialConnection
        Read a single byte of data from the serial connection. The byte data is returned as a signed integer value.
        Specified by:
        readInputByte in class SerialConnection
        Returns:
        the signed integer representation of the read byte. If the byte was read correctly then this value will be between 0-255. If the byte could not be read then will return a value of -1.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the serial connection could not be read from.

      • writeData

        boolean writeData(byte[] data)
        Description copied from class: SerialConnection
        Writes the given array of bytes to the serial line using whatever method is appropriate for the sub-classing connection.
        Specified by:
        writeData in class SerialConnection
        Parameters:
        data - the data to write to the serial line.
        Returns:
        true if the data was written to the serial line, false otherwise.
